elements.title: Florida's first state park (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that women including May Mann Jennings (pictured) were responsible for creating Florida's first state park?

elements.title: AMAN-23 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that naval units from around 50 countries took part in the Pakistani naval exercise AMAN-23?

elements.title: Hugo Krabbe (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Hugo Krabbe stirred up much controversy in the interwar period by arguing that the law, not the state, is the true sovereign?

elements.title: Scaramouche (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a 1943 performance of Darius Milhaud's Scaramouche used anagrams to disguise the suite and its composer from Nazi censors?

elements.title: Jane Severance (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that all three of Jane Severance's books for young readers include lesbian characters, including her first book, which was the first picture book to include such characters?

elements.title: Battle of Cirta (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when the Numidian king Syphax attempted to rally his fleeing army at the Battle of Cirta he was thrown from his horse and captured?

elements.title: Andrew Sorrell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Andrew Sorrell, State Auditor of Alabama, initially ran for election to the Alabama House of Representatives when his father declined to run for the seat?

elements.title: Bulandshahr: Or, Sketches of an Indian District (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Frederic Growse's book Bulandshahr: Or, Sketches of an Indian District annoyed the British Indian government so much that they allowed only one edition?
